text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with penne pasta with peas and
prosciutto hey who said the depression
has to be depressing this is good cheap
eats probably five dollars or less for
this recipe and let me show you how to
put this together by the way this was
inspired by Clara and her depression
cooking series on YouTube so this is
kind of my version of her macaroni and
peas recipe I'm going to take a little
bit of olive oil couple pennies worth in
my stock pot here with an onion diced up
you go medium medium-high heat pretty
much the whole way and then to flavor
this up some very expensive prosciutto
ham actually this was serrano ham the
same thing this is really thin look you
can literally see through it so while
this is a really expensive kind of fancy
splurge ingredient if you just get a
couple really thin slices that was like
25 cents worth ahem so I'm going to take
the a couple pieces of ham there dice it
up nice and small and what I'm going to
do is I'm going to saute that with the
onions in that little bit of olive oil
and that's going to really flavor this
dish for not a lot of money so we're
going to cook that for about 5-6 minutes
the onions are going to kind of sweeten
up that flavor the ham is really going
to be brought out then I'm going to dump
in three sliced cloves of garlic you
don't always have to mince and crush
sliced is really garlic used more as a
vegetable okay because it's a much more
subtle flavor when you slice it I'm
going to put in a nice amount of fresh
ground black pepper some red pepper
flakes
all right nice big pinch of salt and you
want to make sure you salt your foods
well during a recession because you
sweat more you're nervous you sweat you
need to replace the salt on your body
then I'm going to add in about two
quarts of liquid six cups to eight cups
I would say is a good range depending on
how soupy you want this I kind of like
mine brothy so I put about eight I'm
also going to add some dry thyme by the
way I had homemade chicken stock that
was made with the leftover carcass from
that lemon chicken we did so I never
throw away the bones you can always make
a quick little chicken stock I'm going
to put in some tomato sauce and make
sure you rinse out the cup at your
grandma or your great-grandma they
didn't waste anything during the
Depression all right
for the pasta I'm going to use a Barilla
Plus which is the whole-grain
high-fiber version it tastes great
tastes like regular pasta look at all
that fiber not only is it nutritious you
all know that's good for you I know you
hear that regularly but it also
high-fiber foods keep you feeling fuller
and longer
it's perfect for a depression or
recession whatever it is then I'm going
to add in my white beans and a pound of
frozen peas that I thawed we're going to
bring that back to a boil I'm going to
taste for salt here if I'm going to boil
pasta like this before I throw it in and
because I tasted it I realize hey it
needs more salt so I put some more salt
in I dump the Box a penny in give it a
stir and I'm going to boil that for
about seven minutes now Clara taught us
that you can just dump this in turn off
the heat and save gas Clara turned off
her heat as soon as she added the pasta
and let the heat from the stock cook the
you know cook the macaroni the rest of
the way but you know Clara things aren't
that bad at least not yet but I did kind
of compromise I boiled this about I
don't know six seven minutes so you can
see there the pasta starting to swell up
then I'm going to turn it off all right
when the Heat's off I'm going to dump in
my cheese grated Parmesan it's about the
only really expensive thing in here and
it's just a little bit we're going to
cover it and I'm going to set the timer
for about five or six minutes and the
pasta pretty much absorbed the rest of
the liquid almost because I put a good
amount of stock in here like I said I
like my kind of broth II so that is just
perfect for me if you put less broth in
you're going to have a you know a
thicker thicker product up to you all
right and there it is depression not
depressing penne pasta with peas and
prosciutto little grated cheese on top a
little hot pepper on top and that's it
I'm going to dig in here frugal cooking
